intro: Perityle quinqueflora, commonly known as the five-flowered perityle, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
